snippet: The bill, which would not allow spending on health care to grow any faster than the state’s overall economy through 2017, is the first in the nation to seek to rein in the growth in costs.
abstract: Massachusetts passes legislation that seeks to limit the growth of health care costs in the state; first such bill in the nation would not allow spending on health care to grow any faster than the state’s overall economy through 2017.
lead_paragraph: The bill, which would not allow spending on health care to grow any faster than the state’s overall economy through 2017, is the first in the nation to seek to rein in the growth in costs.

headline.seo: Massachusetts Aims to Cut Growth of Its Health Costs
headline.main: Massachusetts Aims to Cut Growth of Its Health Costs
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts Aims to Cut Growth of Its Health Costs
